title: 5 Ways To Cut Down On Screen Time
summary: Screen time can provide a variety of benefits to your child including increased cognitive and language skills, increased problem-solving skills, improved social skills and improved hand-eye coordination. It can also be a great way for your child to learn new things, such as when they watch educational programming. Screen time may also negatively impact your childâ€™s academic performance and brain development. There is some research that suggests excessive screen time may contribute to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and dyslexia in children.

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"What Are The Benefits Of Screen Time?"),mdx("p",null,"Screen time can provide a variety of benefits to your child including increased cognitive and language skills, increased problem-solving skills, improved social skills and improved hand-eye coordination. Additionally, screen time can be a great way for your child to learn new things, such as when they watch educational programming. It can also be a great way for them to connect with family and friends who live far away. It can also help to relieve boredom, which can be a major issue for kids with too much downtime."),mdx("p",null,"Screen time can also be a helpful tool when it comes to transitioning to a new environment or situation, such as when you\u2019re traveling. It can help to distract your child from the unfamiliar surroundings and provide some comfort and familiarity in a new situation."),mdx("h2",null,"What Are The Risks Of Screen Time?"),mdx("p",null,"While screen time can provide benefits for your child, there are also some risks associated with it. These include the risk of decreased social skills, sleep disruption or sleep disorders, a decrease in physical activity and the potential for your child to develop a negative body image."),mdx("p",null,"In addition, there is some research that suggests excessive screen time may contribute to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and dyslexia in children. Screen time may also negatively impact your child\u2019s academic performance and brain development."),mdx("h2",null,"Know Where Your Child Is While Screen-ing"),mdx("p",null,"While there\u2019s no hard and fast rule about how much screen time your child should receive, it\u2019s important that you know what they\u2019re doing when they engage with digital media. Knowing what sites they visit and what they search for online can help you to understand more about your child\u2019s digital habits and make informed decisions about how much screen time they receive. This will allow you to screen content more effectively and keep your child safe online."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s also important that you know what applications your child is using. This includes apps on their phone, on your home computer or on any other devices that they have access to. You can monitor what apps your child is using by setting up account restrictions on their devices or by installing monitoring software on your computer."),mdx("h2",null,"Set Timers For Screen-ing"),mdx("p",null,"Setting timers for your child\u2019s screen time can help to create an awareness about the amount of time they spend looking at a screen. This can be helpful for monitoring the amount of time kids spend on their devices, watching television or playing video games. You can set specific timers for different devices, which allows you to keep track of their screen time more effectively."),mdx("p",null,"There are a number of apps and websites that allow you to track how much time your child spends on their devices. There are also some devices, such as the Family Timer, that allow you to track screen time manually. These kinds of devices can be helpful if you want to keep track of screen time for more than one child."),mdx("h2",null,"No Screens At Dinnertime Or During Bedtime"),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s important to create some boundaries around screen time and set expectations for when your child can and cannot use devices. If you have a child who spends a lot of time on their devices, it\u2019s important that you have set hours when they can\u2019t use them. You can use this time for other activities, such as reading or playing outside. You can also use this time for family bonding activities, such as playing board games or doing puzzles."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s also important that you set boundaries around bedtime. While there\u2019s nothing wrong with your child using screens before bed, it\u2019s important that you have consistent rules about when they can use them."),mdx("h2",null,"Take Shorter Breaks In Between Screen Sessions"),mdx("p",null,"In between screen time sessions, it\u2019s a good idea to take short breaks. Ideally, you want to take a break that lasts at least 20 minutes. This will give your child a chance to rest and recharge before getting back to their devices again."),mdx("p",null,"Taking breaks between screen time sessions is also a good way to help prevent screen addiction. This can be especially important for young children who are still developing their brains. It\u2019s important to avoid screen time before bedtime as well. It can keep your child from getting the sleep they need to function the next day."),mdx("p",null,"Taking regular breaks from your devices can have major benefits for your overall health and well-being. It can help to reduce stress, increase feelings of happiness and improve your mood. It can also help to improve your attention span, productivity and ability to focus."),mdx("h2",null,"One Last Thing"),mdx("p",null,"Parenting in the digital age brings with it a whole host of new challenges. relatedArticles.title: How to Get Out of a Style Rut

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The risk of falling into a style rut is something we all have to deal with from time to time. It happens to even the most confident and daring of people, so you\u2019re certainly not alone if you feel like your style is stagnating and you can\u2019t think of anything new or exciting to wear. Whether it\u2019s because you haven\u2019t found a new piece of clothing that excites you in months, or because you just don\u2019t know what to wear after wearing variations on the same theme for several weeks in a row, everyone gets stuck in a rut now and again. Thankfully there are ways to get out of it and discover a new lease on your personal style once again."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Make Your Home More Energy Efficient

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As the cost of living continues to rise, it\u2019s more important than ever for Americans to find ways to save money and stay within a budget. After all, no one wants to feel like they\u2019re drowning in bills every month.
To that end, everyone could probably stand to tighten their belts a little bit when it comes to their day-to-day expenses; after all, there are several small things we can do on a daily basis that will collectively add up and help us save money in the long run. In this blog post, we\u2019ll cover everything you need to know about energy efficiency at home and how you can start saving money by making your house more efficient today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get through a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Everyone knows break-ups are tough. Even if you know the relationship is ending, the final moments can still be filled with pain and heartbreak. However, a breakup doesn\u2019t need to be final in every sense of the word. In time, you will recover from your failed relationship and move on with your life. Here are some effective ways to make this happen sooner rather than later.
If you\u2019ve recently broken up with your partner or dating partner, it can feel like the end of the world. But it\u2019s not! A relationship coming to an end does not mean there is something wrong with you or that you aren\u2019t good enough for anyone or that you will never find love again. Your heart is broken at this moment because you cared deeply about this person - now you just have to understand why and how things went south so that it doesn\u2019t happen again in your future relationships`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you love something, it feels like there\u2019s not enough time in the day to do everything you want to do. But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Start Living a More Eco-Friendly Lifestyle

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Did you know that a single person produces about 1.6 tons of CO2 per year? Did you also know that producing one cotton t-shirt uses almost 19 gallons of water and produces 3.5lbs of CO2?"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How the Pandemic Is Changing the Way We Work

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Time is money, as the saying goes. And when you\u2019re grappling with pandemic disease and a global outbreak, time spent at work has a whole different set of implications.
Pandemic flu strains have decimated human populations since the first recorded pandemic in 541 AD. Over the centuries, outbreaks have been frequent enough to instill fear in even the most stoic among us.
Today we face another pandemic threat with the potential to be even more devastating than those which came before it. A highly virulent strain of influenza A virus known as influenza pandemia has begun spreading rapidly throughout much of the world.
In many ways, today\u2019s workplace is very different from that of a century ago. Technology has advanced; office structures are more open and collaborative; and workers are expected to demonstrate self-motivation and flexibility in order to thrive in an ever-changing workplace environment.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New Year\u2019s resolutions are like a clean slate for the coming year. What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to save Money as a College Student
The Ultimate Guide to Spring Cleaning Your Home

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Home cleaning in spring is the best time to thoroughly clean your home. As the weather gets warmer, so does our house. Dirt and grime that has accumulated over the long winter months begins to dissipate as we put away all of our heavy coats, hats, and gloves. With fewer layers to trap it, dust, germs, and other nasty particles are exposed for what they really are: gross!
We all know that a tidy home is a happy one. Keeping a tidy household at all times can be challenging. The pressures of work and other responsibilities often get in the way of keeping things clean and organized. But with some preparation and planning you can make spring home cleaning your primary focus instead of an afterthought. Here\u2019s how\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stress during the Holiday Season
